text: Canton of Marseille – Sainte-Marguerite is a former canton of France, located within the commune of Marseille in the Bouches-du-Rhône department, in the Provence-Alpes-Côte d'Azur region. It was created 27 February 2003 by the decree 2003-156 of that date. It was disbanded following the French canton reorganisation which came into effect in March 2015. Its population was 36,125 in 2012.Populations légales 2012: Téléchargement du fichier d'ensemble, INSEE Elected to represent the canton in the General Council of Bouches-du-Rhône : * Didier Garnier (UMP, 2001-2008) ==Area== It is composed of the part of the 9th municipal arrondissement of Marseille not within the Canton of Marseille- Mazargues. == See also == * Arrondissement of Marseille * Cantons of the Bouches-du-Rhône department * Communes of the Bouches-du-Rhône department ==References== Category:Former cantons of Marseille Marseille - Sainte- Marguerite Category:2015 disestablishments in France Category:States and territories disestablished in 2015 Category:2003 establishments in France
title: Canton of Marseille – Sainte-Marguerite
